intro: Deinbollia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sand mat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes or rocky areas. Deinbollia angustifolia is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
